title: Authorities Find Body Believed to Be 23-Year-Old Man Who Disappeared After Hailing a Ride to Rocky Mountain National Park
description: Blake Kieckhafer was last seen on Aug. 7
content:
NEED TO KNOW
• None Officials found a body believed to be a man who went missing after hailing a ride share service to Rocky Mountain National Park in Colorado last week, officials say
• None On Thursday, Aug. 14, a Rocky Mountain National Park spokesperson said authorities found remains likely associated with Blake Kieckhafer, 23, from Omaha, Neb., a day earlier
• None Kieckhafer was last seen in the Upper Beaver Meadows area of the park on Aug. 7, around 5:20 p.m. local time, when he was dropped off by the ride share service

Officials have found a body believed to be a man who went missing after hailing a ride share service to Rocky Mountain National Park in Colorado last week, a park official says.

A Rocky Mountain National Park spokesperson announced on Thursday, Aug. 14, that authorities found remains likely associated with Blake Kieckhafer, 23, from Omaha, Neb., a day earlier. The body was recovered above Emerald Lake.

"Rocky Mountain National Park rangers completed an on-scene investigation and recovery operations took place by helicopter," a park spokesperson said in a statement. "His body was flown to a landing zone in Rocky Mountain National Park and transferred to the Larimer County Coroner’s Office."

Search efforts began after Kieckhafer's family reported him missing to park rangers on Monday, Aug. 11, a National Park Service spokesperson said in a statement on Tuesday, Aug. 12.

Kieckhafer was last spotted in the Upper Beaver Meadows area of the park on Aug. 7, around 5:20 p.m. local time, when he was dropped off by the ride share service, the NPS spokesperson said.

Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.

"Investigations lead to search efforts being focused in the Emerald Lake area on Wednesday. Over 80 people were involved in yesterday’s search efforts," the park spokesperson said.

The Larimer County Coroner's Office will confirm the identity of the body, according to the Rocky Mountain National Park statement.

a Rocky Mountain National Park spokesperson
the Rocky Mountain National Park statement

summary: Officials have found a body believed to be 23-year-old man who went missing after hailing a ride share service to Rocky Mountain National Park in Colorado last week. The remains were likely associated with Blake Kieckhafer, who was last seen in the Upper Beaver Meadows area of the park on Aug. 7. The body was recovered above Emerald Lake following an on-scene investigation and recovery operations by helicopter. The identity of the body will be confirmed by the Larimer County Coroner's Office.
shortSummary: Officials found a body believed to be missing 23-year-old Blake Kieckhafer, who went missing after hailing a ride share service in Rocky Mountain National Park.

argos_summary: Authorities have discovered a body believed to be that of Blake Kieckhafer, a 23-year-old man from Omaha, Nebraska, who went missing after taking a ride share to Rocky Mountain National Park on August 7. The remains were found above Emerald Lake, and search efforts began after his family reported him missing on August 11. The Larimer County Coroner's Office will confirm the identity of the body.
